definition[0]: a person or group of people whose job is to protect the rights of people who buy things and to make sure companies do not do anything illegal or harmful
definition[2]: an independent organization responsible for making sure that companies in a particular industry or business do not do anything illegal
example[1]: Franceâ€™s stock market watchdog is conducting a routine investigation of trading.
example[2]: This week, the consumer watchdog updated its guidelines on selling white goods.
